00022 #ifndef DESIGNBYCONTRACT_H
00023 #define DESIGNBYCONTRACT_H

00031 class DesignByContract {
00032 
00033         public:
00034 
00035 #ifndef NDEBUG
00036                 virtual ~DesignByContract();
00037 
00038                 virtual bool isValid() const;
00039 
00040                 static void __throw_error_(const char *file, const int line,
00041                                              const char *expr, const char *type);
00042 
00043                 static void __report_Message_(const char *file, const int line, const char *msg);
00044 
00045 #endif
00046 
00047 };
00048 
00049 // The debug mode also defines the following macros. Failure of any of these macros leads to
00050 // program termination. The user is notified of the error condition with the right file name
00051 // and line number. The actual failing operation is also printed using the stringizing operator #
00052 
00053 #ifndef NDEBUG
00054 
00055         #define ASSERT__(type,expr) if (!(expr)) DesignByContract::__throw_error_(__FILE__, __LINE__, #expr,type)
00056 
00057         #define ASSERT(expr) ASSERT__("ASSERTION",expr)
00058         #define IS_VALID(obj) ASSERT__("CONSTISTENCY CHECK",(obj) != NULL && (obj)->isValid())
00059         #define IS_VALID_REF(obj) ASSERT__("CONSTISTENCY CHECK",(obj).isValid())
00060         #define REQUIRE(expr) ASSERT__("PRE-CONDITION",expr)
00061         #define ENSURE(expr) ASSERT__("POST-CONDITION",expr)
00062 
00063         #define MESSAGE(msg) DesignByContract::__report_Message_(__FILE__,__LINE__,msg)
00064 
00065 #else
00066 
00067         // When built in release mode, the _DEBUG flag would not be defined, thus there will be no overhead
00068         // in the final release from these checks.
00069 
00070         #define ASSERT(expr) ((void) 0)
00071         #define IS_VALID(expr) ((void) 0)
00072         #define IS_VALID_REF(expr) ((void) 0)
00073         #define REQUIRE(expr) ((void) 0)
00074         #define ENSURE(expr) ((void) 0)
00075 
00076         #define MESGAGE(msg) ((void) 0)
00077 
00078 #endif
00079 
00080 #endif
